text:
Pinckard is a town in Dale County, Alabama, United States. At the 2010 census the population was 647. Pinckard was incorporated in 1893.
Geography.
Pinckard is in southeastern Dale County at (31.312803, -85.545713). It is bordered to the east by the town of Midland City and to the northwest by the town of Newton. The northeast border of Pinckard follows the northeast side of U.S. Route 231, a four-lane highway which leads northwest to Ozark, the county seat, and southeast to Dothan.
According to the U.S. Census Bureau, the town has a total area of, of which, or 0.16%, is water.
